isis.stitle: Body Builder Electrical Data Book - SINGLE REDUCTION AXLES: SPICER S100-S, S105-S, S135-S, S150-S - REMOVE - CARRIER FROM AXLE HOUSING

step1.para: Remove drain plug and drain lubricant.
Disconnect drive shafts at rear U-joint.

note.para: If end yoke and/or seal is to be replaced, loosen yoke nut at this time.

step1.para: Hold a large brass drift or a brass hammer against center of the axle shaft flange. Strike the drift with sharp blows from a large hammer or sledge until the axle shaft separates from the hub.

warning.para: Do not strike the flange directly with a steel hammer or sledge. This may crack and splinter material, possibly causing serious or fatal injury. Do not pry or chisel axle flange away from hub; damage to sealing surfaces could occur.

step1.para: Support the differential carrier assembly on a roller jack. Secure as necessary to prevent it from falling off the jack when removed from the housing.
Loosen the carrier-to-housing mounting bolts. Remove all bolts except top two. These two bolts will prevent the carrier assembly from falling.

Separate differential carrier from the housing using removal slots ( Figure 5). Be certain carrier is balanced properly on jack, and remove top two carrier mounting bolts. Remove differential carrier assembly from the axle housing.

figure.caption: Figure 5. Separate Differential Carrier From Housing Using Removal Slots

step1.para: Mount carrier assembly in a suitable rebuild stand. (Refer to SPECIAL TOOLS.)
